hints.content:
An $\blueE{\text{even}}$ number is a number that can be split into $2$ equal groups.

We find $\blueE{\text{even}}$ numbers by making sure every object in the group has a pair.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9d50cd961bb1ee962eb60cc708a5e737e9d4486c)

Examples of $\blueE{\text{even}}$ numbers are $\blueE2, \blueE4,\blueE6, \blueE8, \blueE{10},  . .  .$

An $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ number **cannot** be split into $2$ equal groups. 

We find $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ numbers by trying to pair objects and finding there is **not** always a pair.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/10c3af09ebfcd0c6d05b4edd219f33894cc4d8b9)

Examples of $\maroonD{\text{odd}}$ numbers are $\maroonD1, \maroonD3, \maroonD5, \maroonD7, \maroonD9, . . . $

In this image, there are $\blueE{4}$ hamburgers.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4d4976d842e677f249cb6bc79d0685175cb4d5ee)

Each hamburger has a pair, so there are an even number of hamburgers.

In this image, there are $\blueE{20}$ carrots.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c258bfb2ae95d393e6eae1dd263638b232071a45)

Each carrot has a pair, so there are an even number of carrots.

In this image, there are $\maroonD{19}$ caterpillars.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/90baefe56e628ed0978ab77ef6c7e1bb5e670fc9)

Each caterpillar does **not** have a pair, so there are an odd number of caterpillars.

Here is the completed table:

Image | Even/Odd
- | - | -
![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/35690dc0e513fda5a3f32eaf1392ff3827d1d039) |**Even**
![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bac864d91523c1143fe43c7be07e50f001d2ee0c) | **Even**
![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5e59729a9e3da5aeac604cc122047dde9abea39b)  | **Odd**

question.content:
**Determine whether the number of objects is even or odd.**

- | - | -
